item.title: Tiling WMs, aka ricing the Windows
item.description: Throughout most of my career I worked with Microsoft technologies, mainly with .NET and C#. This meant that my daily driver operatin system has mostly been Windows, as even after the advent of .NET Core (which can be run on Linux), I had to maintain some classic .NET applications, which only ran on Windows, and could only be easily developed with Visual Studio. But I had a short period of time during which I mainly worked on some TypeScript and NodeJS applications, and did not need Windows for my day to day work.
